intro: Cercestis gabunensis, commonly known as the Gabon flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that resemble flames, which are typically borne in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. The flowers are pollinated by birds and insects, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
